밥 = rice / meal (casual, everyday)
식사 = meal (polite/neutral formal)
진지 = meal (honorific — offering food to elders)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 밥 먹었어? / 식사하셨습니까? / 할아버지, 진지 드세요.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Did you eat? / Have you had your meal? (polite) / Grandfather, please have your meal. (honorific)

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to be merely; nothing more than
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 이것은 시작에 불과하다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: This is merely the beginning.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: regardless of
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 남녀를 불문하고 지원 가능합니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: You can apply regardless of gender.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: based on; grounded in
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 사실에 입각하여 판단해야 한다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: You must judge based on facts.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: equivalent to; on par with
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 정규직에 준하는 대우를 받는다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Receiving treatment on par with full-time employees.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: starting with; led by
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 대통령을 위시하여 관계자들이 참석했다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Officials attended, led by the president.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to be absorbed in; devoted entirely to
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 그는 연구에 여념이 없다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: He is entirely absorbed in research.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to recall; to be reminded of
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 초심을 상기해야 할 때다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: It's time to recall our original intentions.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to be attributable to; to originate from
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 이 문제는 소통 부재에 기인한다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: This problem is attributable to a lack of communication.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to be reminiscent of; to rival
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 전쟁터를 방불케 하는 현장이었다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: It was a scene reminiscent of a battlefield.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to contribute to
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 사회 발전에 이바지하고 싶다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: I want to contribute to the development of society.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: due to; because of (formal cause)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 폭우로 인해 도로가 통제되고 있다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Roads are being restricted due to heavy rain.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: in light of; considering
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 과거 사례에 비추어 볼 때 이번에도 같은 결과가 예상된다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: In light of past cases, the same result is expected this time.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: prior to; before (formal)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 회의에 앞서 간단한 인사가 있겠습니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Prior to the meeting, there will be a brief greeting.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: regardless of; irrespective of
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 이념을 막론하고 민생이 우선이다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Regardless of ideology, people's livelihoods come first.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: owing to; on account of (very formal/literary)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 그의 실수로 말미암아 프로젝트가 지연되었다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Owing to his mistake, the project was delayed.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: ranging to; extending up to
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 어린이에서 노인에 이르기까지 모두가 참여했다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Everyone participated, from children to the elderly.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: is nothing other than; is precisely
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 이것은 국민에 대한 배신에 다름 아니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: This is nothing other than a betrayal of the people.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: is nothing more than; merely
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 그건 변명에 지나지 않는다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: That's nothing more than an excuse.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to reach the point of; to come to
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 결국 파산하기에 이르렀다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: It eventually reached the point of bankruptcy.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: not only... but also (written/formal)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 실력이 뛰어날 뿐더러 인품도 훌륭하다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Not only is their skill outstanding, but their character is excellent too.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: it's a good thing that...; fortunately (otherwise...)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 빨리 발견할 망정이지 늦었으면 큰일 날 뻔했다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Good thing it was discovered quickly — any later and it would have been a disaster.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: I would say that; in my humble opinion (very formal/literary)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 생각건대 이 문제는 쉽게 해결되지 않을 것이다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: In my estimation, this problem will not be easily resolved.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: consider it as; treat it as if
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 경험을 쌓는 셈치고 해 보자.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Let's do it, considering it as gaining experience.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: not stopping at; going beyond just
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 단순한 비판에 그치지 않고 대안을 제시해야 한다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: You shouldn't stop at mere criticism — you need to present alternatives.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: can only; all one can do is; merely
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 감사할 따름입니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: I can only be grateful.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: as (was stated/done); the fact that; having (done)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 앞서 언급한 바와 같이 이 문제는 시급하다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: As was mentioned earlier, this issue is urgent.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: on the occasion of; at the time of
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 창립 50주년에 즈음하여 기념행사를 개최합니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: On the occasion of the 50th anniversary, a commemorative event will be held.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: given that; considering that (archaic/formal concessive)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 사태가 이에 이를진대 더 이상 방관할 수 없다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Given that the situation has reached this point, we can no longer stand by.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: by means of; by doing (instrumental — distinguishing from ~(으)로서 'as/in the capacity of')
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 지속적인 연구로써 문제를 해결할 수 있다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The problem can be solved by means of continuous research.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: as long as; so long as; to the extent that
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 법이 허용하는 한 최선을 다하겠습니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: I will do my best as long as the law permits.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: even if only; at least (concessive — settling for less)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 작은 도움이나마 되고 싶습니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: I want to be of help, even if only a little.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: cannot help but; have no choice but to
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 현 상황에서는 구조조정을 할 수밖에 없다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: In the current situation, there is no choice but to restructure.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: now that; since (it is the case that)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 약속한 이상 반드시 지켜야 한다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Now that you've made a promise, you must keep it.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: including; starting with; such as
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 한국을 비롯하여 동아시아 국가들이 참여했다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: East Asian countries including Korea participated.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: given the circumstances that; since (with background situation)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 예산이 부족한 터에 추가 지출은 어렵다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Given that the budget is insufficient, additional spending is difficult.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: there is a possibility/risk of; could potentially
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 이 조항은 오해를 불러일으킬 소지가 있다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: This clause has the potential to cause misunderstandings.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: in accordance with; pursuant to
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 관련 법률에 의거하여 처분을 내렸다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The disposition was made pursuant to the relevant laws.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: on the other hand; while; whereas
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 수출은 증가한 반면 내수는 감소했다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: While exports increased, domestic demand decreased.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: not only... but also
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 경제적 손실뿐만 아니라 인명 피해도 발생했다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Not only economic losses but also casualties occurred.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: according to
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 통계청 자료에 따르면 출산율이 역대 최저를 기록했다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: According to Statistics Korea data, the birth rate hit a record low.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: it amounts to; it's as if; effectively
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 하루에 커피를 세 잔 마시니 한 달에 15만 원을 쓰는 셈이다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Drinking three cups of coffee a day, it amounts to spending 150,000 won per month.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: there is room for / there is no room for
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 이 사안에 대해서는 논의의 여지가 없다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: There is no room for discussion on this matter.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: it stands to reason that; one might well (expect)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 그 정도면 화를 낼 법도 하다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Given that much, it's understandable that one might get angry.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: precisely; none other than; truly (emphatic topic marker)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 교육이야말로 국가의 미래를 좌우하는 핵심이다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Education is precisely the key that determines a nation's future.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: in contrast to; whereas; while on the other hand
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 젊은 층이 찬성하는 데 반해 기성세대는 반대하고 있다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: While the younger generation is in favor, the older generation is opposed.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: amid; in the midst of; while
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 경기 침체가 심화되는 가운데 실업률이 상승하고 있다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Amid the deepening recession, the unemployment rate is rising.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: given that it will be the case; since it is expected that (very formal/literary)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 예산이 삭감될 터인즉 대안을 마련해야 한다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Given that the budget will be cut, we must prepare alternatives.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: because of; as a result of (unexpected/undesirable cause)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 갑자기 비가 오는 바람에 행사가 취소되었다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Because it suddenly rained, the event was canceled.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: if one intends to; if one is going to (formal/literary conditional)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 성공할 양이면 남다른 노력이 필요하다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: If one intends to succeed, extraordinary effort is required.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: in that; in the sense that; from the standpoint that
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 모든 국민에게 영향을 미친다는 점에서 신중한 접근이 필요하다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: In that it affects all citizens, a cautious approach is needed.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: it has been reported that
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 피해자는 현재 병원에서 치료를 받고 있는 것으로 전해졌다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: It has been reported that the victim is currently receiving treatment at a hospital.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: it is known that; it has been revealed that
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 해당 기업은 이미 파산 절차에 들어간 것으로 알려졌다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: It is known that the company has already entered bankruptcy proceedings.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: it has been found/shown that (reporting survey or data results)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 조사 결과 시민의 70%가 정책에 반대하는 것으로 나타났다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The survey found that 70% of citizens oppose the policy.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: it has been confirmed that
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 사고 원인은 운전자의 부주의인 것으로 확인되었다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: It has been confirmed that the cause of the accident was the driver's negligence.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: it has been uncovered/revealed that
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 공금을 유용한 사실이 감사를 통해 드러났다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: It was revealed through an audit that public funds had been embezzled.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: it is projected/expected that
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 내년 경제 성장률은 2%대에 머물 전망이다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The economic growth rate is projected to remain at around 2% next year.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: it appears/seems that (journalistic hedging)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 양측의 합의까지는 상당한 시간이 걸릴 것으로 보인다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: It appears that reaching an agreement between the two sides will take considerable time.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: it is the policy/plan to
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 정부는 내년부터 규제를 대폭 완화할 방침이다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The government plans to significantly ease regulations starting next year.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to step forward to; to take action toward
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 시민단체들이 환경 보호를 위한 캠페인에 나섰다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Civic groups have stepped forward to campaign for environmental protection.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to urge; to call for
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 야당은 정부에 즉각적인 대책 마련을 촉구했다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The opposition party urged the government to prepare immediate countermeasures.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to cause ripples/repercussions
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 대표이사의 돌연 사임으로 업계에 큰 파장이 일고 있다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The CEO's sudden resignation is causing major repercussions in the industry.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: controversy arises; to spark debate
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 새로운 교육 정책을 둘러싸고 논란이 일고 있다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Controversy is arising over the new education policy.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: the outcome is being closely watched
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 대법원의 최종 판결에 귀추가 주목된다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The outcome of the Supreme Court's final ruling is being closely watched.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: it is forecast/expected that
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 올해 수출액은 사상 최고치를 기록할 것으로 전망된다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Exports this year are forecast to reach a record high.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: it is a trend that; there is a tendency toward
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 비대면 서비스를 선호하는 소비자가 늘어나는 추세이다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: There is a growing trend of consumers preferring contactless services.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to examine; to investigate (academically)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 본 연구에서는 한국 사회의 저출산 원인을 고찰하고자 한다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: This study aims to examine the causes of low birth rates in Korean society.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to discuss; to argue (in academic discourse)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 효율성만을 논할 것이 아니라 공정성도 고려해야 한다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: We should not only discuss efficiency but also consider fairness.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: in terms of; when it comes to
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 정책을 수립하는 데 있어 국민의 의견을 반영해야 한다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: When it comes to establishing policy, public opinion must be reflected.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to be premised on; on the assumption of
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 이 이론은 합리적 경제 주체를 전제로 한다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: This theory is premised on rational economic agents.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to be limited/confined to
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 이 현상은 특정 지역에 국한되지 않는다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: This phenomenon is not confined to a specific region.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: it is thought/considered that (formal academic)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 추가적인 연구가 필요한 것으로 사료된다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: It is considered that additional research is necessary.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: there is a need to
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 기존 연구의 한계를 극복할 필요가 있다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: There is a need to overcome the limitations of existing research.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to be correlated with
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 교육 수준과 소득은 밀접한 상관관계가 있다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Education level and income are closely correlated.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to suggest; to imply (in academic/analytical context)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 이 결과는 기존 이론의 재검토가 필요함을 시사한다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: These results suggest that a re-examination of existing theories is necessary.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to be based on; to be grounded in
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 본 논문의 분석은 실증적 데이터에 근거한다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The analysis in this paper is grounded in empirical data.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to be in violation of; to contravene
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 해당 행위는 현행법에 저촉될 수 있다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The act in question may contravene current law.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to promulgate; to officially announce (a law)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 정부는 개정된 법률을 관보에 공포했다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The government promulgated the amended law in the official gazette.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to fall under; to constitute
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 이 행위는 사기죄에 해당한다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: This act constitutes fraud.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to have the obligation to
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 고용주는 근로자의 안전을 보장할 의무가 있다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The employer has the obligation to guarantee workers' safety.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: regarding; concerning (used in legal/official titles and documents)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 개인정보 보호에 관한 법률이 개정되었다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The law regarding personal information protection has been amended.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to regard as; to deem
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 기한 내 회신이 없을 경우 동의한 것으로 간주합니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: If no reply is received within the deadline, it will be deemed as consent.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to comply with; to observe (rules, laws)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 모든 참가자는 대회 규정을 준수해야 한다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: All participants must comply with the competition regulations.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: commensurate with; corresponding to
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 위반의 정도에 상응하는 처벌이 내려질 것이다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Punishment commensurate with the degree of the violation will be imposed.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: in accordance with what was (decided/stated)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 이사회에서 결의한 바에 따라 인사 개편을 단행합니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: In accordance with the board's resolution, a personnel reorganization will be carried out.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to not permit; to prohibit
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 당국은 무허가 시위를 불허한다고 밝혔다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The authorities stated that unauthorized protests will not be permitted.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: I promise to (formal pledge to audience)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 국민의 기대에 부응할 것을 약속드립니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: I promise to live up to the expectations of the people.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: I will do my best to (formal commitment)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 국민의 안전을 지키는 데 최선을 다하겠습니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: I will do my best to protect the safety of the people.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: please (do something) (formal request/directive)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 질서를 유지해 주시기 바랍니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Please maintain order.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: I intend to; I would like to (formal speech opener)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 오늘은 우리 회사의 미래 전략에 대해 말씀드리고자 합니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Today, I would like to speak about our company's future strategy.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: I earnestly request/urge that
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 안전 수칙을 철저히 지켜 주실 것을 당부드립니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: I earnestly urge you to thoroughly observe the safety regulations.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: I humbly request that you (very polite request)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 관련 서류를 기한 내에 제출해 주시기를 부탁드립니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: I request that you submit the relevant documents within the deadline.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: inasmuch as; given that; to the extent that
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 모두가 노력한 만큼 좋은 결과가 있을 것입니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Given that everyone has worked hard, there will be good results.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to express one's deepest (gratitude, condolences, or apology)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 유족에게 심심한 위로의 말씀을 드립니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: I express my deepest condolences to the bereaved family.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: I wish to inform you that (formal notification)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 다음 달부터 운영 시간이 변경됨을 알려 드립니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: I wish to inform you that operating hours will change starting next month.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: please take note of; please be mindful of
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 출입 시 보안 절차에 유의하시기 바랍니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Please take note of the security procedures upon entry.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: shall; will (literary future expressing resolve or prophecy)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 이 땅에 평화가 찾아오리라 믿는다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: I believe peace shall come to this land.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: although it would be; even though (literary concessive)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 가고 싶으련마는 사정이 허락하지 않는다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Although I would like to go, circumstances do not permit it.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: I have been doing; I declare that I (archaic/literary declarative)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 평생을 이 연구에 바쳐 왔노라.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: I have devoted my entire life to this research.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: may it be so!; let there be (literary optative/wish)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 모든 이가 자유를 누릴지어다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: May all people enjoy freedom.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: for; since (literary causal reasoning)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 세월은 기다려 주지 않을지니 오늘을 최선을 다해 살아라.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: For time waits for no one, live today to the fullest.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Like talking to a wall (lit. 'reading sutras to a cow's ear')
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 우(牛) cow + 이(耳) ear + 독(讀) read + 경(經) sutra/scripture
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: No matter what I say, it's like talking to a wall.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: You reap what you sow (lit. 'your own doing, your own reward')
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 자(自) self + 업(業) deed/karma + 자(自) self + 득(得) obtain
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: That's what you get (you brought it on yourself).

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: To give up on oneself; to abandon all hope
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 자(自) self + 포(暴) be violent/reckless + 자(自) self + 기(棄) abandon/discard
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Don't give up on yourself — let's try again.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Sharing joys and sorrows together
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 동(同) together + 고(苦) suffering + 동(同) together + 락(樂) joy/pleasure
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: They're colleagues who shared joys and sorrows for 10 years.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Killing two birds with one stone
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 일(一) one + 석(石) stone + 이(二) two + 조(鳥) bird
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Exercise and stress relief — two birds with one stone.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Preparedness prevents disaster
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 유(有) have + 비(備) preparation + 무(無) without + 환(患) worry/disaster
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 유비무환이라고, 미리 준비해 두는 게 낫다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: As they say, preparedness averts disaster — better to prepare in advance.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Turning misfortune into fortune; a blessing in disguise
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 전(轉) turn + 화(禍) misfortune + 위(爲) become + 복(福) fortune/blessing
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Losing my job actually turned into a blessing in disguise.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Same bed, different dreams (outwardly together but thinking differently)
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 동(同) same + 상(床) bed + 이(異) different + 몽(夢) dream
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: They sat at the negotiating table, but were actually dreaming different dreams.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Things will eventually right themselves; justice prevails in the end
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 사(事) matter/affair + 필(必) necessarily + 귀(歸) return + 정(正) righteous/correct
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: As they say, things right themselves — the truth will come out.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Heart-to-heart understanding; unspoken mutual understanding
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 이(以) by means of + 심(心) heart + 전(傳) transmit + 심(心) heart
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Even without words, we understand each other heart to heart.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: After hardship comes sweetness; no pain, no gain
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 고(苦) bitter + 진(盡) exhaust/end + 감(甘) sweet + 래(來) come
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: They say sweetness follows bitterness — good days have finally come.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Unforgettable gratitude; deeply engraved in one's bones
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 각(刻) carve + 골(骨) bone + 난(難) difficult + 망(忘) forget
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: My benefactor's help is something I can never forget.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: The more the better
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 다(多) many + 다(多) many + 익(益) benefit + 선(善) good
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: When it comes to experience, the more the better.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: A ragtag group; disorganized mob
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 오(烏) crow + 합(合) gather + 지(之) 's (possessive) + 졸(卒) soldiers
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: That team is a disorganized mob with no strategy.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Crows gathering chaotically — no formation, no leader

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Lost in fog; completely in the dark
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 오(五) five + 리(里) ri (distance unit) + 무(霧) fog + 중(中) middle
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: The truth of the case is still completely in the dark.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Can't sit still; on pins and needles
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 좌(坐) sit + 불(不) not + 안(安) comfortable + 석(席) seat
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Waiting for the results, I was on pins and needles.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Blindly following the crowd; joining without thinking
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 부(附) attach + 화(和) harmonize + 뇌(雷) thunder + 동(同) same
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Don't just blindly follow — have your own opinion.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Like echoing thunder mindlessly — agreeing without understanding

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: A lesson from others' mistakes; learning from someone else's example
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 타(他) other + 산(山) mountain + 지(之) 's + 석(石) stone
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 그 회사의 실패를 타산지석으로 삼아야 한다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: We should take that company's failure as a lesson.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: A stone from another mountain can polish your jade — others' failures teach you

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Seeing something awakens desire; tempted by what you see
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 견(見) see + 물(物) thing + 생(生) arise + 심(心) heart/desire
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Seeing delicious food awakens my appetite.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Achievement through extreme diligence (studying by firefly/snow light)
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 형(螢) firefly + 설(雪) snow + 지(之) 's + 공(功) merit/effort
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: His success is the result of tireless diligence.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: From stories of scholars too poor for candles — one read by firefly light, another by snow's reflection

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Fellow sufferers sympathize with each other; misery loves company
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 동(同) same + 병(病) illness + 상(相) mutually + 련(憐) pity/sympathize
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Since we were in the same situation, I helped out of fellow feeling.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Too much is as bad as too little; excess is just as wrong as deficiency
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 과(過) exceed + 유(猶) still/as if + 불(不) not + 급(及) reach
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Even exercise follows the rule of moderation. Overdoing it ruins your body.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Icing on the cake; adding flowers to brocade
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 금(錦) brocade/silk + 상(上) on top + 첨(添) add + 화(花) flower
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: A promotion plus a bonus — icing on the cake.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Surrounded on all sides by enemies; desperate situation with no allies
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 사(四) four + 면(面) sides + 초(楚) Chu (kingdom) + 가(歌) song
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 여론도 등을 돌리면서 대통령은 사면초가에 빠졌다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: With public opinion also turning against him, the president found himself besieged on all sides.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Adding frost on top of snow; to make matters worse
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 설(雪) snow + 상(上) on top + 가(加) add + 상(霜) frost
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: On top of losing my job, to make matters worse, my health deteriorated.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Standing by idly; watching with folded arms
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 수(袖) sleeve + 수(手) hand + 방(傍) beside + 관(觀) watch
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: If you stand by idly watching injustice, you're no different from an accomplice.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: State of ecstasy; being completely absorbed; selfless trance
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 무(無) without + 아(我) self + 지(之) 's + 경(境) state/realm
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: I was so absorbed in the music that I entered a state of ecstasy.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Clear autumn skies (lit. 'sky is high, horses are fat') — the beauty of autumn
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 천(天) sky/heaven + 고(高) high + 마(馬) horse + 비(肥) fat/plump
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: The season of high skies and plump horses — autumn has arrived.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Deceiving with surface changes while the substance stays the same; a swindle
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 조(朝) morning + 삼(三) three + 모(暮) evening + 사(四) four
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: A policy with only its name changed is nothing more than a shell game.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Visiting three times to recruit talent; persistent and sincere effort to win someone over
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 삼(三) three + 고(顧) look back/visit + 초(草) grass/thatched + 려(廬) hut
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 그 인재를 영입하기 위해 삼고초려의 노력을 기울였다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: They made every effort, like visiting the thatched hut three times, to recruit that talent.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Enduring hardships for the sake of future revenge/success; sleeping on firewood and tasting gall
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 와(臥) lie down + 신(薪) firewood + 상(嘗) taste + 담(膽) gallbladder
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: I'm preparing my comeback with the determination of enduring any hardship.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Speaking with one voice; unanimous agreement
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 이(異) different + 구(口) mouth + 동(同) same + 성(聲) voice
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 모든 전문가가 이구동성으로 개혁이 필요하다고 말했다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: All experts unanimously said that reform is needed.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Adapting to the situation; thinking on one's feet
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 임(臨) face/approach + 기(機) opportunity/moment + 응(應) respond + 변(變) change
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: I dealt with the unexpected situation by thinking on my feet.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Snatching life from the jaws of death; a miraculous recovery
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 기(起) rise + 사(死) death + 회(回) return + 생(生) life
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: They snatched victory from defeat with a dramatic goal in the second half.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Worrying oneself sick; burning with anxiety
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 노(勞) labor + 심(心) heart + 초(焦) scorch + 사(思) thought
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Parents worry themselves sick over their children.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Living at ease; leisurely and carefree
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 유(悠) leisurely + 유(悠) leisurely + 자(自) self + 적(適) comfortable/suitable
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 은퇴 후 시골에서 유유자적한 삶을 보내고 있다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: After retirement, I'm living a leisurely life in the countryside.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Rewarding good and punishing evil
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 권(勸) encourage + 선(善) good + 징(懲) punish + 악(惡) evil
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Traditional fairy tales contain the lesson of rewarding good and punishing evil.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Never forgetting, asleep or awake; constantly thinking of something/someone
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 오(寤) awake + 매(寐) asleep + 불(不) not + 망(忘) forget
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: I long for my hometown day and night, never forgetting.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Swallowing the bitter and giving away the sweet — self-sacrifice (esp. by parents)
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 감(甘) sweet + 탄(呑) swallow + 고(苦) bitter + 토(吐) spit out
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: The mother lived her life swallowing the sweet and spitting out the bitter for her children.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: The parent swallows the bitter (hardship) themselves and gives the sweet (good things) to their children.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Scared out of one's wits; soul scattered in terror
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 혼(魂) soul + 비(飛) fly + 백(魄) spirit + 산(散) scatter
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: I was scared out of my wits when a sudden explosion was heard.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: The student surpasses the master; blue comes from indigo but is bluer
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 청(靑) blue/green + 출(出) come out + 어(於) from + 람(藍) indigo
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: For the disciple to surpass the master — the student has outshone the teacher.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: A narrow escape from death; surviving against all odds (nine deaths, one life)
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 구(九) nine + 사(死) death + 일(一) one + 생(生) life
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: I barely survived the landslide by the narrowest of margins.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Caught between a rock and a hard place; can neither advance nor retreat
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 진(進) advance + 퇴(退) retreat + 양(兩) both + 난(難) difficult
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 사업을 계속하자니 적자고, 그만두자니 투자금이 아까워 진퇴양난이다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Continuing the business means losses, but quitting means wasting the investment — I'm caught between a rock and a hard place.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: To make a comeback; to rally after defeat
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 권(捲) roll up + 토(土) earth/dust + 중(重) again + 래(來) come
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: We failed, but we're looking for a chance to make a comeback.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Stubbornly clinging to outdated methods (lit. 'carving a mark on the boat to find a dropped sword')
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 각(刻) carve + 주(舟) boat + 구(求) seek + 검(劍) sword
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 시대가 변했는데 아직도 각주구검식으로 하면 안 된다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Times have changed — you can't keep doing it the old way.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: From a story about a man who dropped his sword from a boat, carved a mark on the hull, and tried to find it at that spot after the boat moved

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Every shot hits the mark; unerring accuracy
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 백(百) hundred + 발(發) shoot + 백(百) hundred + 중(中) hit
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: That player hits every free throw without fail.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Great talents mature late; a late bloomer
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 대(大) great + 기(器) vessel + 만(晩) late + 성(成) achieve
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: As they say, great talents mature late — he finally succeeded in his fifties.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: A bosom friend; an inseparable companion
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 막(莫) none + 역(逆) go against + 지(之) 's + 우(友) friend
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: We have been the closest of friends since childhood.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: A clear mirror and still water; a calm and unclouded mind
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 명(明) bright + 경(鏡) mirror + 지(止) still + 수(水) water
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: You must judge with a calm and unclouded mind.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Karmic retribution; every action has its consequence
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 인(因) cause + 과(果) result + 응(應) respond + 보(報) repay
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 나쁜 짓을 하면 인과응보를 받는 법이다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: If you do bad things, karmic retribution will catch up with you.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: A negative example; someone whose mistakes teach you what not to do
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 반(反) opposite + 면(面) face/side + 교(教) teach + 사(師) teacher
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: I took his failure as a lesson in what not to do.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Running around in confusion; not knowing which way to turn
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 우(右) right + 왕(往) go + 좌(左) left + 왕(往) go
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: People ran around in confusion during the emergency.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: The whole story from beginning to end
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 자(自) from + 초(初) beginning + 지(至) to + 종(終) end
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Please explain the whole story from beginning to end.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Careful and thorough deliberation; deep consideration
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 심(深) deep + 사(思) think + 숙(熟) mature/ripe + 고(考) consider
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: After careful deliberation, I decided to change jobs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Making rapid progress day by day and month by month
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 일(日) day + 취(就) accomplish + 월(月) month + 장(將) advance
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: His Korean skills are improving by leaps and bounds.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Running about busily in all directions
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 동(東) east + 분(奔) run + 서(西) west + 주(走) dash
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: I'm exhausted from running around in all directions preparing for the event.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Self-praise; blowing one's own trumpet
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 자(自) self + 화(畫) paint/draw + 자(自) self + 찬(讚) praise
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: There's a limit to how much you should praise yourself.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Matching words with actions; practicing what one preaches
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 언(言) words + 행(行) actions + 일(一) one + 치(致) reach/arrive
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: If you are a leader, it is important to practice what you preach.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Unprecedented and unrepeatable; one of a kind
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 전(前) before + 무(無) without + 후(後) after + 무(無) without
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: That is an unprecedented and unrepeatable record in history.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Fighting a lonely battle; struggling alone against the odds
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 고(孤) solitary + 군(軍) army + 분(奮) exert + 투(鬪) fight
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Don't struggle alone — ask for help.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Charging recklessly in all directions; dashing about without a plan
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 좌(左) left + 충(衝) charge + 우(右) right + 돌(突) rush
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: He grew his business by charging ahead recklessly in every direction.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Repaying kindness with ingratitude; biting the hand that feeds you
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 배(背) turn one's back + 은(恩) grace + 망(忘) forget + 덕(德) virtue
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: I helped them, but they turned out to be an ungrateful person.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: A life-or-death decision; risking everything
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 사(死) death + 생(生) life + 결(決) decide + 단(斷) sever/judge
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: I entered the match with a do-or-die determination.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Helpless; unable to do anything; with hands tied
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 속(束) bind + 수(手) hands + 무(無) without + 책(策) plan
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: We were helpless in the face of the sudden disaster.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Progressing at lightning speed; advancing a thousand miles at once
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 일(一) one + 사(瀉) pour + 천(千) thousand + 리(里) ri (distance)
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: The negotiations progressed at lightning speed.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: A candle flickering in the wind; a precarious situation
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 풍(風) wind + 전(前) before + 등(燈) lamp + 화(火) fire
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: The company's survival hangs in the balance like a candle in the wind.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: The fisherman's gain; profiting from others' conflict
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 어(漁) fish + 부(夫) man + 지(之) 's + 리(利) profit
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 두 회사가 싸우는 사이에 어부지리로 이익을 챙겼다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: While the two companies fought, a third party profited from the conflict.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: The guilty party acting indignant; the thief wielding the stick
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 적(賊) thief + 반(反) instead + 하(荷) carry + 장(杖) stick
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 잘못해 놓고 오히려 화를 내다니 적반하장이다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Making a mistake and then getting angry about it — that's the pot calling the kettle black.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Sweet talk; honeyed words used to deceive
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 감(甘) sweet + 언(言) words + 이(利) profitable + 설(說) speech
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Don't be fooled by honeyed words.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Wholehearted devotion; single-minded loyalty
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 일(一) one + 편(片) piece + 단(丹) red/sincere + 심(心) heart
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: I will live with wholehearted devotion to my country.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: A once-in-a-thousand-years opportunity; an extremely rare chance
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 천(千) thousand + 재(載) years + 일(一) one + 우(遇) encounter
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: This is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity, so don't let it slip away.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Catching everything in one net; a complete roundup
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 일(一) one + 망(網) net + 타(打) strike + 진(盡) exhaust/all
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: The police rounded up the entire criminal organization in one sweep.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: A lone wolf; someone who insists on doing everything alone
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 독(獨) alone + 불(不) not + 장(將) general + 군(軍) army
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: If you act like a lone wolf, teamwork falls apart.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Gaining two things with one action; double benefit from a single effort
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 일(一) one + 거(擧) raise/act + 양(兩) two + 득(得) gain
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 재활용하면 환경도 지키고 비용도 줄이고 일거양득이다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Recycling protects the environment and reduces costs — a double benefit.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Gratitude beyond death; a debt of kindness one can never forget
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 백(白) white + 골(骨) bone + 난(難) difficult + 망(忘) forget
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: The kindness of saving my life is a debt I can never repay, even in death.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: Things keep getting harder (lit. 'the further you go, the bigger the mountain')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 해결하려고 했는데 갈수록 태산이다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: I tried to resolve it but things just keep getting harder.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: The tail wagging the dog (lit. 'the belly button is bigger than the belly')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 수리비가 배보다 배꼽이 더 크다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: The repair cost is more than the thing itself.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To be generous (lit. 'big hands') — esp. with food/hosting
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 우리 엄마는 손이 커서 항상 많이 해.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: My mom is generous so she always makes a lot.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: Well-connected; knows many people (lit. 'wide feet')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 그 사람은 발이 넓어서 어디든 아는 사람이 있다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: He's so well-connected that he knows someone everywhere.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: Not even enough to notice (of food — still hungry)
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 이거 먹어도 간에 기별도 안 간다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: Even after eating this, I don't feel a thing.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: Picky eater (lit. 'short mouth')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 아이가 입이 짧아서 먹이기 힘들다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: The kid is a picky eater so it's hard to feed them.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To bear a heavy burden/responsibility (lit. 'heavy shoulders')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 팀장이 되니까 어깨가 무겁다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: Now that I'm team lead, the weight on my shoulders is heavy.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To fall out of favor
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 상사 눈 밖에 나면 힘들어진다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: If you fall out of your boss's favor, things get tough.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To have high standards / be picky (lit. 'high eyes')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 눈이 높아서 아직 결혼을 못 했다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: Their standards are so high they haven't married yet.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: Easily swayed by others' opinions (lit. 'thin ears')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 귀가 얇아서 남 말에 잘 넘어간다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: He's easily influenced and falls for what others say.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To be arrogant/snobbish (lit. 'high nose')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 코가 높아서 남을 무시하는 경향이 있다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: They're arrogant and tend to look down on others.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: Words become reality; be careful what you say
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 말이 씨가 된다고, 부정적인 말은 하지 마.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: They say words become seeds — don't say negative things.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To be stabbed in the back; betrayed unexpectedly
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 믿었던 동료한테 뒤통수를 맞았다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: I got stabbed in the back by a colleague I trusted.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: A piece of cake; extremely easy (lit. 'eating cold porridge')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 이 정도는 식은 죽 먹기지.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: Something like this is a piece of cake.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: A matter of extreme urgency (lit. 'fire on the top of your foot')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 마감이 내일인데 발등에 불이 떨어졌다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: The deadline is tomorrow — it's a five-alarm fire.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: Nearly impossible (lit. 'picking stars from the sky')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 서울에서 집 사기는 하늘의 별 따기다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: Buying a house in Seoul is next to impossible.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To be heartbroken; to feel one's heart being torn apart
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 아이가 우는 모습을 보니 가슴이 찢어졌다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: Seeing the child cry tore my heart apart.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To be extremely busy; no time to even blink (lit. 'no time to open eyes and nose')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 연말이라 눈코 뜰 새 없이 바쁘다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: It's year-end so I'm incredibly busy with no time to breathe.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To rack one's brains; to scheme; to think hard (sometimes implies scheming)
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 어떻게 하면 좋을지 머리를 굴려 봤다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: I racked my brains trying to figure out what to do.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To laugh one's head off; to split one's sides laughing (lit. 'grab one's belly button')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 그 코미디언 공연을 보고 배꼽을 잡았다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: I laughed my head off watching that comedian's show.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To let go; to stop doing something; to neglect (lit. 'release one's hands')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 바빠서 영어 공부에 손을 놓은 지 오래다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: I've been so busy that I stopped studying English a long time ago.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To hold someone back; to be a hindrance (lit. 'grab someone's ankle')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 과거의 실수가 계속 발목을 잡는다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: Past mistakes keep holding me back.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To be tight-lipped; able to keep secrets (lit. 'heavy mouth')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 그 사람은 입이 무거워서 비밀을 맡겨도 된다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: He's tight-lipped, so you can trust him with secrets.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To wait desperately; to wait until one's eyes fall out
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 편지를 눈이 빠지게 기다렸다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: I waited desperately for the letter.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To be proud/haughty; to have a stiff upper lip (lit. 'bridge of the nose is strong')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 그녀는 콧대가 세서 쉽게 타협하지 않는다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: She's too proud to compromise easily.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To hear something so many times you're sick of it (lit. 'nails driven into ears')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 공부하라는 소리를 귀에 못이 박히게 들었다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: I've heard 'study!' so many times I'm sick of it.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To be bold/gutsy; to have a lot of nerve (lit. 'big liver')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 사장 앞에서 그런 말을 하다니, 간이 크구나.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: Saying something like that in front of the boss — you've got nerve.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To be on the edge of one's seat; nail-biting (lit. 'clutch sweat in one's hands')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 결승전이 손에 땀을 쥐는 접전이었다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: The final was a nail-biting close match.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To be dumbfounded; jaw-dropping (lit. 'mouth falls open like rice cake')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 호텔 방에 들어가니 입이 떡 벌어졌다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: When I entered the hotel room, my jaw dropped.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: So precious/adorable (of children); to love dearly (lit. 'wouldn't hurt even if put in one's eye')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 손녀가 눈에 넣어도 아프지 않을 만큼 예쁘다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: My granddaughter is so precious I could eat her up.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: Packed; no room to set foot (lit. 'no gap to step')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 지하철이 출근 시간이라 발 디딜 틈이 없었다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: The subway during rush hour was so packed there was no room to stand.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To be tempted by what one hears; ears perking up (lit. 'ears are prickled')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 반값 세일이라는 말에 귀가 솔깃했다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: My ears perked up at the mention of a half-price sale.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To deeply hurt someone's feelings (lit. 'drive a nail into someone's chest')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 그 한마디가 부모님 가슴에 못을 박았다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: That one remark drove a nail into my parents' hearts.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To wait eagerly for a long time (lit. 'wait until one's neck falls off')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 합격 통보를 목이 빠지게 기다렸다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: I waited endlessly for the acceptance notice.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To be anxious/worried; to feel one's insides burning
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 연락이 안 돼서 속이 탔다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: I was burning with anxiety because I couldn't reach them.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To tighten one's belt; to be frugal out of necessity
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 불경기에 허리띠를 졸라매고 살고 있다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: We're tightening our belts and getting by during the recession.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To praise someone endlessly (lit. 'saliva dries in one's mouth')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 선생님이 그 학생을 입에 침이 마르도록 칭찬했다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: The teacher praised that student until running out of breath.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To be on pins and needles; extremely uncomfortable (lit. 'sitting on a needle cushion')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 잘못을 들키고 바늘방석에 앉은 기분이었다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: After my mistake was discovered, I felt like I was sitting on pins and needles.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To catch a clue; to get a lead on something (lit. 'grab the tail')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 드디어 범인의 꼬리를 잡았다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: We finally caught a lead on the culprit.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To break into a cold sweat; to have a hard time (lit. 'squeeze out cold sweat')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 면접에서 예상 못한 질문에 진땀을 뺐다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: I broke into a cold sweat from an unexpected question during the interview.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: A fish in water; someone in their element; thriving in the right environment
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 무대에 서니 물 만난 고기처럼 신이 났다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: Once on stage, he was like a fish in water — completely in his element.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To lose one's mind; to go crazy with greed or anger (lit. 'eyes rolling')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 세일 소식을 듣자마자 눈이 돌아가서 다 사 버렸다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: As soon as I heard about the sale, I went crazy and bought everything.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To be imminent; right around the corner (lit. 'approaching the tip of one's nose')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 시험이 코앞에 닥쳤는데 아직 준비를 못 했다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: The exam is right around the corner but I still haven't prepared.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To be loose-lipped; unable to keep secrets (lit. 'light mouth')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 그 사람은 입이 가벼워서 비밀을 말하면 안 돼.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: He's loose-lipped, so you shouldn't tell him secrets.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To listen attentively; to lend an ear (lit. 'tilt one's ear')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 학생들이 선생님의 이야기에 귀를 기울였다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: The students listened attentively to the teacher's story.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To be short-handed; not enough people to help (lit. 'hands are insufficient')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 주문이 밀려서 손이 모자란다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: Orders are piling up and we're short-handed.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To be stuck; unable to leave or go somewhere (lit. 'feet are tied')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 폭설 때문에 공항에서 발이 묶였다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: I was stranded at the airport because of heavy snow.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To be jealous of someone's success (lit. 'stomach hurts')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 친구가 승진했다는 소식에 솔직히 배가 아팠다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: Honestly, I was jealous when I heard my friend got promoted.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To turn one's back on someone; to abandon (lit. 'turn one's back')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 어려울 때 모두가 등을 돌렸다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: When times got tough, everyone turned their backs on me.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 경찰이 눈에 불을 켜고 범인을 찾고 있다.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To speak unanimously; to say the same thing in one voice (lit. 'gather mouths')

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To stop visiting; to cut ties with a place (lit. 'sever one's feet')

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: In the blink of an eye; in an instant (lit. 'while blinking an eye')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 눈 깜짝할 사이에 아이가 이렇게 컸다.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To fix or repair something; also to teach someone a lesson (lit. 'look at one's hands')

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To grin from ear to ear; to beam with joy (lit. 'mouth hangs on the ears')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 합격 소식을 듣고 입이 귀에 걸렸다.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To stamp one's feet in frustration or anxiety (lit. 'stomp feet thump-thump')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 버스가 눈앞에서 떠나자 발을 동동 굴렀다.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To catch some sleep; to doze off briefly (lit. 'attach one's eyes')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 밤새 일하다가 잠깐 눈을 붙였다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: I caught a brief nap after working all night.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To wash one's hands of something; to quit a shady business (lit. 'wash hands')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 그는 도박에서 손을 씻고 새 출발을 했다.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To become set in one's ways; inflexible thinking (lit. 'head hardens')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 나이가 드니까 머리가 굳어서 새로운 걸 배우기 힘들다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: As I get older, my thinking gets rigid and it's hard to learn new things.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To work oneself to the bone; back-breaking labor (lit. 'spine comes out')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 등골이 빠지게 일해도 월급은 그대로다.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To hear something so often it stings; tired of hearing (lit. 'ears sting')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 일찍 자라는 말을 귀가 따갑게 들었다.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To stake everything on something; to be desperate about (lit. 'hang by the neck')

관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: I've staked everything on that project, so it must succeed.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To keep one's mouth shut; to remain silent (lit. 'close one's mouth')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 그 사건에 대해 모두가 입을 다물었다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: Everyone kept their mouths shut about the incident.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To work well together; to be in perfect sync (lit. 'hands and feet match')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 오래 같이 일해서 이제 손발이 잘 맞는다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: We've worked together so long that we're in perfect sync now.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: A day-old puppy doesn't fear the tiger; the young and inexperienced are fearless
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 신입이 사장한테 직접 건의하다니, 하룻강아지 범 무서운 줄 모르는구나.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: The new hire made a suggestion directly to the CEO — talk about not knowing what they're up against.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: A frog in a well; someone with a narrow worldview
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 여행을 다녀와 보니 내가 우물 안 개구리였다는 걸 깨달았다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: After traveling, I realized I had been a frog in a well.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: Fixing the barn after losing the cow; too late to prevent damage
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 사고가 난 후에야 안전 점검을 하다니, 소 잃고 외양간 고치는 격이다.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 호랑이도 제 말 하면 온다더니, 방금 네 이야기를 하고 있었어.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: An unfortunate coincidence; bad timing creates suspicion (lit. 'the crow flies off and the pear falls')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 내가 지나가자마자 꽃병이 깨졌는데, 까마귀 날자 배 떨어진 격이다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: The vase broke right when I walked by — just an unfortunate coincidence.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: A dragon rising from a stream; a great person from humble origins
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 가난한 집안에서 의사가 되다니, 개천에서 용 났다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: Becoming a doctor from a poor family — a dragon has risen from the stream.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: An empty cart rattles the loudest; those who know least talk the most
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 아는 것도 없으면서 목소리만 크다니, 빈 수레가 요란하다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: Talking so loud without knowing anything — the empty cart rattles the most.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: A candle in the wind; a precarious and fragile situation
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 회사의 경영 상태가 바람 앞의 등불이다.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: Like a dog that chased a chicken staring at the roof; helplessly watching after losing one's chance
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 기회를 놓치고 닭 쫓던 개 지붕 쳐다보듯 멍하니 서 있었다.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: Even monkeys fall from trees; even experts make mistakes
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 그렇게 실력 있는 선수도 실수하네, 원숭이도 나무에서 떨어지는 법이지.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: Even such a skilled player makes mistakes — even monkeys fall from trees.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: The day you go happens to be market day; an unexpected coincidence
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 가는 날이 장날이라고, 도착하자마자 비가 쏟아졌다.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: Habits formed at age three last until eighty; old habits die hard
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 세 살 버릇 여든까지 간다고, 어릴 때부터 올바른 습관을 길러야 한다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: As they say, habits from age three last to eighty — you should build good habits from childhood.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: A story of catching clouds; vague or unrealistic talk
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 구체적인 계획 없이 구름 잡는 이야기만 하고 있다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: Without any concrete plan, they're just talking about pie in the sky.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: The ground hardens after rain; adversity makes one stronger

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: If a small bird tries to follow a crane, its legs will split; don't overreach beyond your means
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 부자 친구를 따라 쓰다가는 뱁새가 황새 따라가면 가랑이 찢어진다.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To eat noodles; to attend someone's wedding (noodles are served at Korean weddings)

관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 합격도 안 했는데 월급부터 계산하다니, 떡 줄 사람은 생각도 않는데 김칫국부터 마신다.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 이것저것 하다 보니 죽도 밥도 안 됐다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: I tried doing this and that and ended up with nothing — neither here nor there.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To earn one's keep; to pull one's weight (lit. 'earn the price of rice')

관용어 (Korean Idioms).korean: 콩으로 메주를 쑨다 해도 안 믿는다
관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: Wouldn't believe it even if told meju is made from beans; to completely distrust someone

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To be quick at reading the room; perceptive and socially aware (lit. 'fast nunchi')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 눈치가 빨라서 분위기를 금방 파악한다.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To grow fond of; to become emotionally attached over time
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 처음엔 싫었는데 살다 보니 이 동네에 정이 들었다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: I didn't like it at first, but after living here a while, I've grown attached to this neighborhood.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 뒷담화를 하다가 본인한테 들킨 적이 있다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: I once got caught gossiping behind someone's back.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: Feelings of both love and hate; a love-hate bond formed over time
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 오래 사귀다 보니 미운 정 고운 정 다 들었다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: After being together so long, we've built up both love and resentment.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To communicate well; to be on the same wavelength (lit. 'words connect')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 그 친구하고는 말이 잘 통해서 같이 있으면 편하다.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To be like-minded; to click with someone (lit. 'hearts match')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 처음 만났는데 마음이 맞아서 금방 친해졌다.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To feel embarrassed or ashamed (lit. 'face is hot')

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To save face; to keep up appearances
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 체면을 차리느라 도움을 요청하지 못했다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: I couldn't ask for help because I was trying to save face.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To hold grudges; to harbor resentment after a conflict
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 그 사람은 뒤끝이 있어서 한번 싸우면 오래 간다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: He holds grudges, so once you fight with him, it lasts a long time.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To read the room; to gauge others' reactions cautiously (lit. 'look at nunchi')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 상사 눈치를 보느라 자기 의견을 말하지 못했다.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To lose affection; to fall out of love (lit. 'affection drops')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 계속 실망시키더니 이제 정이 떨어졌다.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To be cold-hearted and merciless (lit. 'no blood, no tears')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 그렇게 잘라 버리다니 피도 눈물도 없는 사람이다.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To feel at ease; to let one's guard down (lit. 'release one's heart')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 검사 결과가 정상이라 이제 마음을 놓았다.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: The pot calling the kettle black; criticizing others for faults you share
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 너도 똑같이 하면서 사돈 남 말 하고 있네.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 신나서 이야기하는데 찬물을 끼얹지 마.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: Don't pour cold water on me when I'm excitedly talking about it.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To eagerly step up to help; to jump in with both feet (lit. 'take off shoes and step forward')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 이웃이 어려움에 처하자 모두가 발 벗고 나섰다.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To do pointless or wasted work (lit. 'to shovel')

관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: I went in the wrong direction and ended up doing pointless work all day.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: Strike while the iron is hot; do it while you have the momentum (lit. 'pull the ox horn while it's hot')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 쇠뿔도 단김에 빼라고, 결심했으면 바로 시작해.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: Strike while the iron's hot — if you've made up your mind, start right away.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: A resolution that lasts only three days; failing to keep a commitment
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 다이어트를 시작했지만 또 작심삼일이 되고 말았다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: I started a diet, but once again it only lasted three days.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: A pretty but tasteless wild apricot; all show, no substance
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 그 식당은 인테리어만 화려하고 빛 좋은 개살구다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: That restaurant has fancy decor but the food is nothing special — all style, no substance.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: A journey of a thousand li begins with a single step
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 천리 길도 한 걸음부터라고, 작은 것부터 시작해 보자.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step — let's start with the small things.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: Knock on a stone bridge before crossing; look before you leap
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 돌다리도 두들겨 보고 건너라고, 계약 전에 꼼꼼히 확인해.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: Look before you leap — check everything carefully before signing the contract.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: Gather dust to make a mountain; every little bit adds up
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 티끌 모아 태산이라고, 매일 조금씩 저축하면 큰돈이 된다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: Every little bit adds up — if you save a little each day, it becomes a large sum.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To roll up one's sleeves; to get down to serious work
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 더 이상 미룰 수 없어서 팔을 걷어붙이고 일을 시작했다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: I couldn't put it off any longer, so I rolled up my sleeves and got to work.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: See one thing and know ten; you can judge the whole from a part
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 하나를 보면 열을 안다고, 그 사람의 행동만 봐도 성격을 알 수 있다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: As the saying goes, you can tell ten things from one — just watching their behavior reveals their character.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: Even a sheet of paper is lighter when held by two; teamwork makes things easier
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 백지장도 맞들면 낫다고, 같이 하면 금방 끝낼 수 있어.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: Two heads are better than one — if we work together, we can finish quickly.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: Reading scriptures to a cow; wasting your breath on someone who won't listen
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 그 사람한테 아무리 조언해 봤자 소 귀에 경 읽기다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: No matter how much advice you give that person, it's like talking to a wall.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: A tree destined to grow tall is recognized from its first leaves; talent shows early
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 될성부른 나무는 떡잎부터 알아본다더니, 어릴 때부터 재능이 보였다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: They say you can spot talent early — even as a child, the gift was obvious.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: The more urgent it is, take the longer path; haste makes waste
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 급할수록 돌아가라고, 서두르지 말고 차근차근 하자.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: Haste makes waste — let's not rush and take it step by step.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: Even if you dig a well, dig one well deep; focus on one thing rather than many
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 이것저것 손대지 말고 우물을 파도 한 우물을 파라.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: Don't dabble in everything — if you're going to dig, dig one well deep.
